--- title: "Learning to Love Regexes By Learning Them" subtitle: "I Promised Myself I Wouldn't Do This Again" description: "Building a regex generator for self-contained, well-defined string detection problems is a very effective way to learn regular expressions." format: html: reference-location: margin other-links: - text: Regex Cheatsheet icon: bookmark-plus href: https://github.com/raredd/regex - text: RexEgg icon: bookmark-plus href: https://www.rexegg.com/ - text: Regex in R icon: bookmark-plus href: https://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/base/html/regex.html editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- ::: {.cell} ::: # HCPCS ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} `````{=html} 
                 Count                                 Regex
All              18903 ^[A-CEGHJ-MP-V0-9][0-9]{3}[AFMTU0-9]$
-Level I         10985                  ^[0-9]{4}[AFMTU0-9]$
--Category I      9990                    ^[0-9]{4}[AMU0-9]$
--Category II      565                           ^[0-9]{4}F$
--Category III     430                           ^[0-9]{4}T$
-Level II         7918              ^[A-CEGHJ-MP-V][0-9]{4}$
````` ::: # TODO * If a **wildcard** begins with a **letter**, the *postfix* should be `[0-9]{n}`. * In `remove_redundant()`, try pmap for `rr()` step. ## Checklist - [X] `split_lengths()` - [X] `remove_redundant()` - [X] `split_first()` - [ ] `process_groups()` - `group_3()` - `group_4()` - `group_5()` - [ ] `reduce_groups()` - `reduce_runs()` - `vec_to_regex()` - `red1()` - `red2()` - `red3()` ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: # Preprocessing ::: {.panel-tabset} ## `split_lengths()` ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} split_lengths <- function(x, verbose = FALSE) { stopifnot(is.character(x)) x <- sf_remove(x, "\\*|\\s") |> unique_narm() |> stringr::str_sort() l <- vlen(x) out <- list( x1 = x[l == 1], x2 = x[l == 2], x3 = x[l == 3], x4 = x[l == 4], x5 = x[l == 5]) if (verbose) { cli::cat_boxx( label = view(out), header = glue::glue("{cli::symbol$stop} Split By Lengths"), align = "left", padding = c(0, 1, 0, 1)) return(invisible(out)) } else { return(out) } } random_hcpcs() |> split_lengths() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` $x1 [1] "8" $x2 [1] "27" "36" "41" "77" "78" "87" "C9" "J2" "J8" "V2" $x3 [1] "002" "026" "211" "829" "863" "G88" "G89" "J06" "L20" "V23" $x4 [1] "0409" "2346" "3043" "7610" "8033" "9257" "G011" "G907" "K084" "V210" $x5 [1] "0438T" "0638T" "0736T" "20665" "55450" "99283" "G0467" "G9892" "M1170" [10] "S2095" ``` ::: ::: ## `remove_redundant()` If a vector contains both `"A"` and `"A0"`, remove `"A0"`, i.e., remove longer codes that share a common sub-string with shorter codes. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} remove_redundant <- function(x, verbose = FALSE) { .c(x1, x2, x3, x4, x5) %=% x out <- list( x1 = x1, x2 = rr(x2, x1), x3 = rr(x3, x1) |> rr(x2), x4 = rr(x4, x1) |> rr(x2) |> rr(x3), x5 = rr(x5, x1) |> rr(x2) |> rr(x3) |> rr(x4) ) if (verbose) { cli::cat_boxx( label = view(out), header = glue::glue("{strrep(cli::symbol$stop, 2)} Remove Redundancies"), align = "left", padding = c(0, 1, 0, 1)) return(invisible(out)) } else { return(out) } } random_hcpcs() |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` $x1 [1] "3" "C" "H" "K" $x2 [1] "00" "03" "04" "15" "24" "44" "65" "87" "V2" $x3 [1] "072" "234" "666" "744" "A45" "G88" "G89" "L09" "L71" $x4 [1] "0117" "5985" "9111" "9397" "A641" "J250" "L046" $x5 [1] "46615" "63287" "95974" "J0891" "L3927" "L7366" "P9056" ``` ::: ::: ## `split_first()` ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} split_at <- \(x, y = x, i, z) collapse::rsplit(x, sf_sub(y, i, z), use.names = FALSE) split_1 <- \(x) split_at(x, y = x, i = 1, z = 1) split_end <- \(x) { if (any(sf_detect(x, "[A-Z]$"))) { end <- sf_extract(x, "[A-Z]$") beg <- glue::glue("{take_at(end, 5)}{sf_remove(end, '[A-Z]$')}") c(split_at(x = x[!sf_detect(x, "[A-Z]$")], i = 1, z = 1), split_at(x = end, y = beg, i = 1, z = 2)) } else { split_at(x, i = 1, z = 1) } } split_first <- function(x, verbose = FALSE) { .c(x1, x2, x3, x4, x5) %=% x out <- list( x1 = list(x1), x2 = split_1(x2), x3 = split_1(x3), x4 = split_1(x4), x5 = split_end(x5)) if (verbose) { cli::cat_boxx( label = view(out), header = glue::glue("{strrep(cli::symbol$stop, 3)} Split At First"), align = "left", padding = c(0, 1, 0, 1)) return(invisible(out)) } else { return(out) } } random_hcpcs(50) |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> split_first() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` $x1 $x1[[1]] [1] "0" "1" "3" "8" "P" $x2 $x2[[1]] [1] "20" "22" "28" $x2[[2]] [1] "42" "45" $x2[[3]] [1] "56" "58" $x2[[4]] [1] "64" $x2[[5]] [1] "71" "78" $x2[[6]] [1] "90" "92" "94" "95" "96" $x2[[7]] [1] "A2" "A6" "A9" $x2[[8]] [1] "E1" "E2" $x2[[9]] [1] "G0" "G8" "G9" $x2[[10]] [1] "L1" "L2" $x2[[11]] [1] "M1" [1] "S2066" $x5[[14]] [1] "6102F" ``` ::: ::: ### Letters ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` HCPCS Ending with Letter ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` A : 33 F : 565 M : 13 T : 430 U : 337 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Total: 1378 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` HCPCS Beginning with Letter ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` A : 793 B : 51 C : 548 E : 639 G : 1939 H : 89 J : 1068 K : 175 L : 913 M : 360 P : 57 Q : 462 R : 3 S : 500 T : 113 U : 5 V : 203 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Total: 7918 ``` ::: ::: ::: # Grouping Group each set of vectors into regex patterns. Deal with groups containing letters separately. ::: {.panel-tabset} ## Group 3 ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} group_3 <- function(x) { x <- collapse::get_elem(x, "x3") if (empty(x)) return(x) purrr::map(x, function(x) { idx <- data.table::data.table( code = x, a1 = take_at(x), a2 = take_at(x, 2), a3 = take_at(x, 3)) |> dplyr::mutate(i1 = fastplyr::f_consecutive_id(a1)) |> dplyr::mutate(i2 = fastplyr::f_consecutive_id(a2), .by = a1) |> dplyr::mutate(i3 = fastplyr::f_consecutive_id(a3), .by = c(a1, a2)) lone <- idx |> fastplyr::f_add_count(i1, name = "n1") |> fastplyr::f_filter((i2 + i3 + n1) == 3) last <- idx |> fastplyr::f_filter(code %!in% lone[["code"]]) |> fastplyr::f_select(code, group_id = a1, a2:a3) last <- fastplyr::f_left_join( fastplyr::f_count(last, group_id, a2), fastplyr::f_count(last, group_id, name = "g"), by = "group_id") |> fastplyr::f_filter(n == g) |> fastplyr::f_right_join(last, by = c("group_id", "a2")) |> fastplyr::f_filter(!cheapr::is_na(n)) rest <- idx |> fastplyr::f_filter(code %!in% c(lone[["code"]], last[["code"]])) |> fuimus::combine(group_id, columns = c("a1", "a2"), sep = "") c(if (empty(lone)) NULL else list(lone[["code"]]), if (empty(last)) NULL else codex::chop(last[["code"]], last[["group_id"]]), if (empty(rest)) NULL else codex::chop(rest[["code"]], rest[["group_id"]])) }) } c("C75", "C97", "G02", "G04") |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> split_first() |> group_3() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [[1]] [[1]][[1]] [1] "C75" [[1]][[2]] [1] "C97" [[2]] [[2]][[1]] [1] "G02" "G04" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} long_test2[nchar(long_test2) == 3] |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> split_first() |> group_3() ``` ::: {.cell-output function(x) { x <- collapse::get_elem(x, "x4") if (empty(x)) return(x) purrr::map(x, function(x) { idx <- data.table::data.table( code = x, a1 = take_at(x), a2 = take_at(x, 2), a3 = take_at(x, 3), a4 = take_at(x, 4)) |> dplyr::mutate(i1 = fastplyr::f_consecutive_id(a1)) |> dplyr::mutate(i2 = fastplyr::f_consecutive_id(a2), .by = a1) |> dplyr::mutate(i3 = fastplyr::f_consecutive_id(a3), .by = c(a1, a2)) |> dplyr::mutate(i4 = fastplyr::f_consecutive_id(a4), .by = c(a1, a2, a3)) lone <- idx |> fastplyr::f_add_count(i1, name = "n1") |> fastplyr::f_filter((i2 + i3 + i4 + n1) == 4) last <- idx |> fastplyr::f_filter(code %!in% lone[["code"]]) |> fastplyr::f_select(code, a1:a4) |> fuimus::combine(group_id, columns = c("a1", "a2"), sep = "") last_1 <- fastplyr::f_left_join( fastplyr::f_count(last, group_id, a3), fastplyr::f_count(last, group_id, name = "g"), by = "group_id") |> fastplyr::f_filter(n == g) if (empty(last_1)) { last <- list(code = character(0), group_id = character(0)) } else { last <- last_1 |> fastplyr::f_right_join(last, by = c("group_id", "a3")) |> fastplyr::f_filter(!cheapr::is_na(n)) } rest <- idx |> fastplyr::f_filter(code %!in% c(lone[["code"]], last[["code"]])) |> fuimus::combine(group_id, columns = c("a1", "a2", "a3"), sep = "") c(if (empty(lone)) NULL else list(lone[["code"]]), if (empty(last)) NULL else codex::chop(last[["code"]], last[["group_id"]]), if (empty(rest)) NULL else codex::chop(rest[["code"]], rest[["group_id"]])) }) } c("C751", "C970", "G020", "G040") |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> split_first() |> group_4() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [[1]] [[1]][[1]] [1] "C751" [[1]][[2]] [1] "C970" [[2]] [[2]][[1]] [1] "G020" [[2]][[2]] [1] "G040" ``` (empty(x)) return(x) purrr::map(x, function(x) { indices <- data.table::data.table( code = x, a1 = take_at(x), a2 = take_at(x, 2), a3 = take_at(x, 3), a4 = take_at(x, 4), a5 = take_at(x, 5)) |> dplyr::mutate(i1 = dplyr::consecutive_id(a1)) |> dplyr::mutate(i2 = dplyr::consecutive_id(a2), .by = a1) |> dplyr::mutate(i3 = dplyr::consecutive_id(a3), .by = c(a1, a2)) |> dplyr::mutate(i4 = dplyr::filter((i2 + i3 + i4 + i5 + n1) == 5) |> dplyr::pull(code) last <- indices |> dplyr::filter(code %!in% orphans) |> dplyr::select(code, a1:a5) |> fuimus::combine(group_id, columns = c("a1", "a2", "a3"), sep = "") last <- dplyr::left_join( last |> dplyr::count(group_id, a4), last |> dplyr::count(group_id, name = "g"), by = dplyr::join_by(group_id)) |> dplyr::filter(n == g) |> dplyr::right_join(last, by = dplyr::join_by(group_id, a4)) |> dplyr::filter(!is.na(n)) rest <- indices |> dplyr::filter(code %!in% c(orphans, dplyr::pull(last, code))) |> fuimus::combine(group_id, columns = c("a1", "a2", "a3", "a4"), sep = "") vctrs::vec_c( if (empty(orphans)) NULL else list(orphans), if (empty(last)) NULL else chop(last$code, last$group_id), if (empty(rest)) NULL else chop(rest$code, rest$group_id)) }) } c("C7510", "C9701", "G0200", "G0400") |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> split_first() |> group_5() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [[1]] layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} reduce_runs <- function(x) { if (nchar(x) == 1) return(x) poss <- c(0:9, "&", LETTERS) test <- setNames(rep(0, 37), poss) vctr <- test[c(splitter(x), "&")] vctr <- vctr[!is.na(vctr)] test[names(vctr)] <- 1 test[names(test) == "&"] <- 0 groups <- data.table::data.table( value = names(test), keys = test, group = dplyr::consecutive_id(test)) |> dplyr::mutate(size = dplyr::n(), .by = group) |> dplyr::filter(keys == 1, size >= 3) |> dplyr::select(value, group) if (empty(groups)) return(x) xgroups <- chop(groups$value, groups$group) |> purrr::map(smush) |> purrr::list_c() if (all(xgroups == smush(poss))) return("[A-Z0-9]") replacements <- dplyr::left_join( dplyr::slice_min(groups, by = group, order_by = value) |> dplyr::rename(start = value), dplyr::slice_max(groups, by = group, order_by = value) |> dplyr::rename(end = value), by = dplyr::join_by(group)) |> glue::glue_data("{start}-{end}") |> as.vector() res <- stringi::stri_replace_all_regex(x, xgroups, replacements, vectorize_all = FALSE) bracket(res) } ``` ::: ## `red1()` ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} red1 <- function(x) { if (empty(x[["g1"]])) return(character(0)) x <- collapse::get_elem(x, "g1")[[1]] re <- sort_order(x) |> reduce_runs() if (re == "[A-Z0-9]") return(glue::glue("^{re}{{5}}$")) post <- ifelse(sf_detect(re, "\\[?[0-9]{1}"), "[A-Z0-9]", "[0-9]") glue::glue("^{re}{post}{{4}}$") } hcpcs_tests |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> split_first() |> process_groups() |> red1() ``` ::: {.cell-output stringr::str_split_fixed(x, "", max_vlen(x)) |> as.data.frame() |> purrr::map(unique_narm) |> purrr::map(sort_order) |> purrr::map(reduce_runs) |> delist() multi <- stringfish::sf_nchar(parts, nthreads = 4L) > 1 nobrk <- !sf_detect(parts[multi], "\\[|\\]") parts[multi] <- ifelse(any(nobrk), purrr::map_chr(parts[multi], bracket), parts[multi]) smush(parts) }) ) } all_tests |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> split_first() |> process_groups() |> red2() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [[1]] [1] "15" [[2]] [1] "76" [[3]] [1] "E0" [[4]] [1] "S2" [[5]] [1] "2[027]" [[6]] (empty(x[["g3"]])) return(character(0)) x <- collapse::get_elem(x, "g3") d <- purrr::map_int(x, purrr::pluck_depth) top <- x[d == 1] leave <- top[vlen(top) == 1] top <- top[vlen(top) > 1] nest <- x[d > 1] first <- purrr::map_chr(nest[[1]], function(x) take_at(purrr::pluck(x, 1, 1)[1])) |> collapse::funique() rest <- purrr::map(nest[[1]], function(x) sf_remove(x, glue::glue("^{first}"))) vctrs::vec_c( leave, purrr::map(top, function(x) { x <- top[[1]] x <- top[[2]] parts <- stringr::str_split_fixed(x, "", n = max_vlen(x)) |> as.data.frame() |> purrr::map(unique_narm) |> purrr::map(sort_order) |> purrr::map(reduce_runs) |> delist() multi <- stringfish::sf_nchar(parts, nthreads = 4L) > 1 if (any(multi)) parts[multi] <- parent(paste0(parts[multi], collapse = "|")) smush(unique_narm(parts)) }) ) } ``` ::: ::: # Reduce Groups ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} vec_to_regex <- vrg <- \(x, n) { if (empty(x)) return(character(0)) post <- ifelse(sf_detect(x, "^\\[?[A-Z]\\-?"), "[0-9]", "[A-Z0-9]") x <- data.table::fcase( n == 0, glue::glue("^{x}$"), n == 1, glue::glue("^{x}{post}$"), n == 2, glue::glue("^{x}{post}{{2}}$"), n == 3, glue::glue("^{x}{post}{{3}}$") ) glue::glue_collapse(x) } reduce_groups <- \(x) { list( g1 = p1(x), g2 = purrr::map_chr(x$g2, p2) |> purrr::map_chr(vrg, n = 3) |> glue::as_glue(), g3 = purrr::map_chr(x$g3, p2) |> purrr::map_chr(vrg, n = 2) |> glue::as_glue(), g4 = purrr::map_chr(x$g4, p2) |> purrr::map_chr(vrg, n = 1) |> glue::as_glue(), g5 = purrr::map_chr(x$g5, p2) |> purrr::map_chr(vrg, n = 0) |> glue::as_glue() ) } all_tests[nchar(all_tests) > 2] |> split_lengths() |> remove_redundant() |> process_groups() |> reduce_groups() hcpcs_tests |> split_lengths() |>
